doc:
Nellie Bly Baker https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nellie_Bly_Baker 0 Elizabeth Cochrane Seaman (May 5, 1864 – January 27, 1922), better known by her pen name Nellie Bly, was an American journalist who was widely known for her record-breaking trip around the world in 72 days, in emulation of Jules Verne's fictional character Phileas Fogg, and an exposé in which she worked undercover to report on a mental institution from within. She was a pioneer in her field, and launched a new kind of investigative journalism. Bly was also a writer, industrialist, inventor, and a charity worker. Elizabeth_Cochrane_Seaman ( May_5_,_1864 – January_27_,_1922 ) , better_known by her_pen_name_Nellie_Bly , was an_American_journalist who was_widely_known for her_record-breaking_trip around the_world in 72_days , in emulation of Jules_Verne 's_fictional_character_Phileas_Fogg , and an_exposé in which she worked undercover to_report on a_mental_institution from within . She was a_pioneer in her_field , and launched a_new_kind of investigative_journalism . Bly was also a_writer_,_industrialist_,_inventor , and a_charity_worker .
